DOC.brief_title: AV Fistula Salvage Advanced CKD Using Sodium Bicarbonate Prophylaxis
DOC.detailed_description: The National Kidney Foundation publish kidney disease outcome guideline improve care chronic kidney disease ( CKD ) patient . Regarding hemodialysis vascular access , recommendation early placement arteriovenous fistula ( AVF ) improve morbidity mortality outcomes , specifically glomerular filtration rate le 25ml/min , correspond stage 4 5 CKD . Despite advantage , need surveillance AVF determine maturation use maintain optimal longevity require use interventional procedure . While radiocontrast use lead acute , often reversible kidney injury , use AVF evaluation renew interest recent implication gadolinium-enhanced MRI associate rare disorder skin swell induration call nephrogenic systemic fibrosis . CKD patient particularly susceptible long term adverse outcomes contrast-induced kidney injury , 1 year mortality stage 4 5 CKD patient 44 % 62 % , respectively . While optimal fluid therapy prevent contrast-induced kidney injury remain uncertain , several prospective randomize trial use sodium bicarbonate pretreatment show low incidence contrast-related kidney injury compare isotonic saline . Traditional marker acute kidney injury , include serum creatinine , blood urea nitrogen , creatinine clearance insensitive differentiate contrast-induced kidney injury form renal injury . Kidney injury marker-1 ( KIM-1 ) transmembrane receptor induce high level proximal tubule nephron follow ischemic nephrotoxic injury . KIM-1 show small cohort patient differentiate ischemic kidney injury form acute chronic kidney disease .
